central_thesis: SATAN'S TAROT is presented as a completely redesigned 78-card Tarot-type deck, distinct from traditional Major and Minor Arcanas, based entirely on Satanic concepts and intended for personal experiments and meditation within a Satanic framework.

structure_content.summary: The deck consists of 78 cards. Instead of traditional Major and Minor Arcanas, it features 19 Keys, 9 Satanic Statements, 7 Deadly Sins, 9 Gates of Hell, Gate of the Eternal Void, Gods of Light, Forces of Darkness, and 26 Selected Powers of Hell. Additionally, there are five cards that embody the 10 Alphabets of Desire. Each card measures 3 11/16 inches by 5 inches. The reverse of each card features a Baphomet sigil with a Steve Ditko-esque framing design. The deck includes a 40-page digest-sized booklet that explains the significance and usage of the cards.

The card images are described as striking and often 'conjured from dreams dedicated to the concepts behind each particular card.' They exhibit a 'preponderance of sex and violence,' contributing to a quality of 'explicit archetypal experiences.' Examples include Key 16 depicting those resonating with the Dark Force and White-lighters in death, and Key 6 showing a triumphant naked woman with a Baphomet sigil, dagger, and various demonic figures, including Dr. LaVey.

key_concepts.definition: A reinterpretation of the traditional Major Arcana, specifically designed with Satanic concepts.
Cards embodying core tenets of Satanic philosophy, likely referencing Anton LaVey's statements.
Cards representing the seven deadly sins, likely re-contextualized within a Satanic framework as acts of indulgence rather than transgression.
Cards depicting specific concepts or aspects related to the infernal realm within the Satanic cosmology.
A specific card or concept within the deck's unique Satanic cosmology.
Cards representing deities or concepts associated with 'light' from a Satanic perspective, potentially re-evaluated or re-contextualized.
Cards representing entities, energies, or principles associated with 'darkness' in the Satanic cosmology.
Cards illustrating specific powers or attributes within the infernal or Satanic domain.
Five cards embodying ten alphabets of desire, likely relating to human will, indulgence, and the pursuit of individual gratification within Satanic philosophy.

The quality of the card imagery, often featuring sex and violence, designed to evoke deep, primal, and unconscious responses in the practitioner, aligning with the raw, instinctual aspects of Satanism.

practical_system.description: SATAN'S TAROT functions as a practical system for divination and self-exploration, designed to immerse the practitioner in a Satanic worldview. The unique card structure, with its Keys, Satanic Statements, Deadly Sins, and other infernal concepts, provides a specific lens through which to interpret life events and personal psychology. The imagery, often involving sex and violence, is intended to evoke 'explicit archetypal experiences,' facilitating a deeper, more primal connection to the Satanic current. The accompanying booklet guides the user on the significance of each card and provides instructions for its use in 'personal experiments and meditation,' enabling practitioners to integrate the deck into their magical and philosophical practice.
tools: The 78-card SATAN'S TAROT deck (Black & White or Full Color Edition)
rituals: Card layouts and interpretive practices for divination and self-reflection as outlined in the accompanying 40-page booklet.
Meditative practices involving concentration on the card imagery and their Satanic concepts for personal insights and spiritual alignment.

relevant_quotes.text: Here's something you don't see often, a fully redesigned Tarot-type deck of 78 cards completely based on Satanic concepts.

Gone are the Major and Minor Arcanas. Instead we have 19 Keys, 9 Satanic Statements, 7 Deadly Sins, 9 Gates of Hell, Gate of the Eternal Void, Gods of Light, Forces of Darkness, the 26 Selected Powers of Hell and finally five cards embodying the 10 Alphabets of Desire.
Each card is a generous 3 11/16 inches wide by 5 inches tall. The reverse of each has a Baphomet sigil with a Steve Ditko-esque framing design.

The images on the cards themselves are quite striking-many were conjured from dreams dedicated to the concepts behind each particular card. There is a preponderance of sex and violence in these images, lending them the quality of explicit archetypal experiences.
This deck comes with a 40 page digest sized booklet which explains the cards significance and gives instructions for how to use them.
This is a truly new approach to the Tarot, and if working with such cards has any interest, you will want one of these decks for your personal experiments and meditation.

critical_analysis.relevance: SATAN'S TAROT is highly relevant for Satanists and occultists seeking a divination and meditation system that explicitly aligns with their philosophical and aesthetic principles. It offers a counterpoint to traditional Tarot decks, which are often rooted in Judeo-Christian, Hermetic, or other non-Satanic cosmologies. By replacing standard Arcana with Satanic concepts and featuring provocative imagery, the deck provides a tool for practitioners to engage with the 'dark side' on an intuitive and archetypal level, fostering personal experiments and meditation congruent with their path.
critical_analysis.target_audience: The primary target audience consists of Satanists, practitioners of the Left Hand Path, and individuals deeply involved in modern occultism who identify with Satanic philosophy. It is also suitable for those interested in dark aesthetics and alternative divination methods, particularly collectors of unique occult paraphernalia. The deck is explicitly positioned as a resource for 'personal experiments and meditation' within a Satanic context.
